name: market for landed anchovy by-catch, fresh | landed anchovy by-catch, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21097/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'landed anchovy by-catch, fresh', in the Global geography. This is a constrained market for consequential system model, for attributional system models, this is a regular market. In the case of consequential system model, details about the marginal consumer can be found in the comment of the conditional exchange (by-product).;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of landed anchovy by-catch, fresh from the harbor or port that is landed till the place where it is later sold for human consumption. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'landed anchovy by-catch, fresh' is a by-product of anchovy capture by steel purse seiner and landing whole. By-catch for European anchovy includes other small-pelagics, such as mackerel (Scomber scombrus) or European pilchard (Sardina pilchardus). Moreover, by-catch includes a small amount of tunids.

Activity starts from the harbor or port that landed anchovy by-catch, fresh is landed.

Activity ends with the provision of landed anchovy by-catch, fresh to the respective market for human consumption.
